entry.title: Spacious villa in Cagnes Sur Mer
entry.content:
When we plan big family reunion holidays in south France at the CÃ´te D'Azur we prefer a spacious villa in Cagnes Sur Mer (which actually belongs to a good friend of us).

The villa offers 6 bedrooms 4 of them are overlooking the garden with the large swimming pool. On the ground floor there is a modern kitchen with oven and steamer, American fridge, induction plates as well as a living room, TV room and office. Further there are outside terraces, barbecue and traditional pizza oven, pool house with shower and toilet, petanque field, tennis table and a car port.

https://www.homeaway.com/vacation-rental/p3630546

The swimming pool is managed with a minimal amount of chemicals and salty sea-water, which provides a very soft and comfortable water feeling. It’s heated what is ideal for October holidays, when the temperature in the evening is not as warm anymore.

On the right the petanque field, as well as the pool house, with a warm shower and toilets.


Enough space to get the a big group together on a long table


There is nothing better in autumn than going for jogging in the early morning at the spectacular sea front (with almost no people). The sea front is easy reachable from the house by car in around 10 minutes.

Sunrise in Cagnes, yet another sunny holiday day.

entry.title: Ferme St. Martin
entry.content:
This is a classical provencal 22 acre wine olive state on a hill with a breathtakingly view. We booked the full location for our big family reunion in October 2016 (around 15 people). Taking into consideration that the property was shared by four parties, the price of this luxury estate, was absolutely fair (comparing it to similar hotel offerings).

It’s an outstanding and spacious property of highest quality with a heated pool (very useful in late October holidays) in a lovely environment.

entry.title: Booking Site: Sheepskin
entry.content:
The booking site Sheepskin has a small but amazing collection of cosy holiday cottages mainly located in UK (but as well as in the french alps). They are operating since 6 years and keep their collection deliberately small, so that their team can continue to provide a high level of service, both to the cottage owners they represent and the guests whose holidays they help to craft.

As they state on their website

“There are a large number of companies advertising holiday cottages, but we are confident that few others (if any) offer the bespoke, personal service that we provide for our guests. Our experienced and enthusiastic team has intimate knowledge of our collection and it is a company policy that staff stay in as many properties as possible, so that they have first-hand knowledge to share with guests”.


The website is beautiful done and easy to navigate, the pictures are of high quality.


There is a nifty page feature called “Home truths” which outlines some potential shortcomings of the property.
